trial_identification.studytitle: Physical activity levels of patients with cystic fibrosis admitted to hospital with an acute pulmonary exacerbation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of hospitalisation with an acute pulmonary exacerbation on the physical activity levels, exercise tolerance and grip strength of patients with cystic fibrosis

interventions.interventions: Physical activity levels will be measured, using a SenseWear Pro 3 Armband, for a 24 hour period between days 3 and 5 of the hospitalisation period and 1 month after discharge. A clinical exercise test, the modified shuttle walk test, will be undertaken on day 5/6 of hospitalisation and 1 month after discharge from hospital to assess exercise tolerance. The exercise tests will be undertaken at (slightly) different time points to the assessment of physical activity levels to avoid the exercise tests affecting the measurement of physical activity levels. Skeletal muscle grip strength will be measured between days 3 and 5 of the hospitalisation period and 1 month after discharge using a calibrated Jamar dynamometer. The study will continue until the required sample size (n = 34) is achieved.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Physical activity levels will be measured for a 24 hour period using the SenseWear Pro 3 Armband.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Between days 3 and 5 of hospitalisation and 1 month after discharge from hospital.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Exercise performance levels will be assessed using a performance-based test, namely, the modified shuttle walk test
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Between days 3 and 5 of hospitalisation and 1 month after discharge from hospital.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Grip strength will be assessed using a calibrated Jamar dynamometer on setting 2
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Between days 3 and 5 of hospitalisation and 1 month after discharge from hospital.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Adult patients with cystic fibrosis admitted to the Royal Adelaide Hospital with an acute exacerbation of their pulmonary disease.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients will be excluded if they are unwilling to participate or unable to commit to the 1 month follow-up measurements.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To determine objectively how inactive cystic fibrosis patients are during and after a hospital admission for an acute pulmonary exacerbation by assessing them using a highly accurate physical activity level monitor. The study also seeks to determine whether exercise tolerance and skeletal muscle strength are reduced during periods of hospitalisation for an acute exacerbation.
